page.title: 06LONGVILLE HOTEL,EAST WALL
page.content: The Longville is the only{public house in the area,and is situated on the main road between Much Wenlock and Church Stretton.The building was originally erected as a farm-house in 1790,but became an inn during the late nineteenth century.It has become a centre for the small rural community of Longville,providing drinks,meals, quiet corners for meetings and games such as Darts,Dominoes,and Bar Billiards.The average numbers of customers in a day is about 30,drawn from local residents,farmers,walkers, caravanners,campers and passing motorists.Beer is the most popular drink and as this is a Free House 3 breweries are used.One local brew from Wistanstow has proved popular with visitors.The proprietor and his wife run the hotel between them and employ 3 part-time assistants.
